title: XSS on product comments in transfers

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information: summery: You are able to copy and paste stored XSS code into the comment section of a product in the transfers tab and receive the error. Reproduce: 1. Create a product with the name '"'>' 2. add a transfer with that product 3. now go back to the product use the code button and type the same code for the title . '"'>' 4. you will get a XSS pop-up however ignore it. as soon as you get here you need to get out of the code setting and into the normal text and copy the the little piece of code with the image. 5. delete the code that we put in the html for the XSS. 6. go back to transfers and paste the code that we copied there 7. error ## Impact steal cookie
vulnerability_information_html:
summery:

You are able to copy and paste stored XSS code into the comment section of a product in the transfers tab and receive the error.

Reproduce:

  1. Create a product with the name '"'><img src=x onerror=alert(domain.domain)>'
  2. add a transfer with that product
  3. now go back to the product use the code button and type the same code for the title . '"'><img src=x onerror=alert(domain.domain)>'
  4. you will get a XSS pop-up however ignore it. as soon as you get here you need to get out of the code setting and into the normal text and copy the the little piece of code with the image.
  5. delete the code that we put in the html for the XSS.
  6. go back to transfers and paste the code that we copied there
  7. error

Impact

steal cookie

activities.message: I’m sorry if this is vague my English is not great. And in transfers on step six I meant paste the code Into the comments on the transfer we made
activities.markdown_message: I’m sorry if this is vague my English is not great. And in transfers on step six I meant paste the code Into the comments on the transfer we made

activities.message:
Hi @chj2934,

Thanks for your report. We're have trouble reproducing your issue, would you be able to provide us with more detailed reproduction steps?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @chj2934,

Thanks for your report. We're have trouble reproducing your issue, would you be able to provide us with more detailed reproduction steps?

activities.message: No problem @jenny_shen When you are creating the product the set the title to '"'>'. In the description of the product you type in the html editor box '"'>' once this is done you must back out of the html part of the editor into the normal text and copy the little image with the code around it.(you will get an error message but that is not the vulnerability). Then with that copied you will create a new transfer when creating the transfer select browse products then select the product we created. Set the amount of products to any number and create the transfer. When this is created there will be a comment box bellow as shown in my image. Select that paste your code in and you should receive a error Let me know if you need images of the steps because I am not currently at home
activities.markdown_message:
No problem @jenny_shen

When you are creating the product the set the title to '"'><img src=x onerror=alert(domain.domain)>'. In the description of the product you type in the html editor box '"'><img src=x onerror=alert(domain.domain)>' once this is done you must back out of the html part of the editor into the normal text and copy the little image with the code around it.(you will get an error message but that is not the vulnerability). Then with that copied you will create a new transfer when creating the transfer select browse products then select the product we created. Set the amount of products to any number and create the transfer. When this is created there will be a comment box bellow as shown in my image. Select that paste your code in and you should receive a error

Let me know if you need images of the steps because I am not currently at home

activities.message:
Hi @chj2934,

Thank you for your report! We were able to reproduce the issue and our engineering team is working on a fix.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @chj2934,

Thank you for your report! We were able to reproduce the issue and our engineering team is working on a fix.

activities.message: Thanks again for your report. We're awarding a bounty of $500 for this issue.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks again for your report. We're awarding a bounty of $500 for this issue.

activities.message: @jenny_shen thanks for the bounty. I found you are also able to use the copied xss code and paste in any comment section such as discounts
activities.markdown_message: @jenny_shen thanks for the bounty. I found you are also able to use the copied xss code and paste in any comment section such as discounts

activities.message: @clayton so after more research it turns out that you can copy and paste that code into EVERY comment section on your site domain I don't know if i should submit another report or handle that here.
activities.markdown_message: @clayton so after more research it turns out that you can copy and paste that code into EVERY comment section on your site domain I don't know if i should submit another report or handle that here.

activities.message: This includes the costumer section which if I am correct could give the user admin privileges
activities.markdown_message: This includes the costumer section which if I am correct could give the user admin privileges

activities.message: @chj2934 All the comment boxes use the same code. There's no need to submit additional reports, since the root cause is the same.
activities.markdown_message: @chj2934 All the comment boxes use the same code. There's no need to submit additional reports, since the root cause is the same.

activities.message: Seems you guys fixed it nice work
activities.markdown_message: Seems you guys fixed it nice work

activities.message: @chj2934 We are still working on a fix for this issue. We'll be in touch as soon as that's done.
activities.markdown_message: @chj2934 We are still working on a fix for this issue. We'll be in touch as soon as that's done.

activities.message:
after some more testing the same copy and pasting method for XSS can be achieved with return magic.

just copy the xss image in return magic without saving and paste it in the comment section of any transfer, discount, etc and you will receive a error
activities.markdown_message:
after some more testing the same copy and pasting method for XSS can be achieved with return magic.

just copy the xss image in return magic without saving and paste it in the comment section of any transfer, discount, etc and you will receive a error

activities.message:
Also to copy through return magic you must type something after the image such as 

"image" test

then select them and copy then paste in the comment sections

Ive also noticed you seem to have implemented a fix so whenever i preformed the previous vulnerability there is no error this seems to bypass this
activities.markdown_message:
Also to copy through return magic you must type something after the image such as

"image" test

then select them and copy then paste in the comment sections

Ive also noticed you seem to have implemented a fix so whenever i preformed the previous vulnerability there is no error this seems to bypass this

activities.message: @chj2934 As we already explained to you in #745077, it is irrelevant where the HTML content is copied from. This issue lies in how the editor in the Timeline feature handles pasted content. There is no need to look for other places that content can be copied from.
activities.markdown_message: @chj2934 As we already explained to you in #745077, it is irrelevant where the HTML content is copied from. This issue lies in how the editor in the Timeline feature handles pasted content. There is no need to look for other places that content can be copied from.

activities.message:
Hi @chj2934,

Thanks again for the report. Our team has recently deployed a fix for this issue, and the issue shouldn't be reproducible anymore. Because this was a self-XSS which required some user interaction, we feel that the $500 already awarded is appropriate. Thank you for making Shopify more secure, and we look forward to hearing from you again!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @chj2934,

Thanks again for the report. Our team has recently deployed a fix for this issue, and the issue shouldn't be reproducible anymore. Because this was a self-XSS which required some user interaction, we feel that the $500 already awarded is appropriate. Thank you for making Shopify more secure, and we look forward to hearing from you again!
